instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..
definitions.D9701: What is D9701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with short on <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Maybe I'm having an off day, but this board is pissing me off..
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> came in from another shop, had no backlight.

Found an 8ohm short on <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL>
So, i start taking off all components related, started with caps <CAPACITOR>C9715</CAPACITOR>/16/17/18/19, then took off LVDS since short still there, <CAPACITOR>C9000</CAPACITOR> as well: short is still there!

I took <DIODE>D9701</DIODE> and <RESISTOR>R9708</RESISTOR> off the board, and the short is still there  
  am i missing something because of being braindead today? Or do you guys think there is a short in the board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with short on <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Just wanted to add that the short is there with no screen connected

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with short on <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
ok, nevermind, found it: pad under <CAPACITOR>C9719</CAPACITOR> exploded and shorted to a groundplane in the board.
Now for a very fun coating and reconnecting job...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with short on <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with short on <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
haha lol yeah.. I finally have it fixed though.
Had to run this fucking jumper for the trackpad connector as well, Jesus.
